meta_description: The Portland Art Museum's mission is to engage and enrich diverse communities through the presentation, interpretation, and conservation of art and film.
hours_text:
## Special hours & admission updates

  * January’s Free First Thursday is moving to Thursday, January 8, because of the New Year’s Day holiday.

## Tickets

Tickets are available onsite at the box office or [online](http://web.archive.org/web/20260115012746/https://portlandartmuseum.org/tickets/).

If the ticket purchasing process isn’t accessible to you please reach out to us on the Access line.  
Phone: 503-276-4284   
Email: [access@pam.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20260115012746/mailto:access@pam.org)

For more information, visit our [FAQ](http://web.archive.org/web/20260115012746/https://portlandartmuseum.org/faqs/) page.

## Hours

**Sunday** : 10am – 5pm  
**Monday** : Closed  
**Tuesday** : 10am – 5pm  
**Wednesday** : 10am – 5pm  
**Thursday** : 10am – 5pm*  
 **Friday** : 10am – 5pm  
**Saturday** : 10am – 5pm

*Free admission from 10am – 7pm on the first Thursday of each month.

## Museum holidays

We’re closed every year on:

  * January 1 
  * July 4
  * Thanksgiving
  * December 25

## Admission

### Museum

**Adults:** $27.50  
**Seniors 65+:** $24.50  
**College students (18 – up, with student ID):** $22.50  
**Adult group visit (12 or more):** $24.50  
**Military:** $24.50  
**[Museum members](http://web.archive.org/web/20260115012746/https://portlandartmuseum.org/membership/):** Free  
**Children (17 – younger):** Free  
**[School group visit](http://web.archive.org/web/20260115012746/https://portlandartmuseum.org/educators/) (by reservation):** Free

Ch...
admission_text:
## Do more as a member

Connect, reflect, and be inspired—all while supporting the arts in our community!

Membership includes FREE Museum admission and access to all things Museum and PAM CUT: special exhibitions, [member events](http://web.archive.org/web/20260113093419/https://portlandartmuseum.org/calendar/category/member-events/), ongoing programs, lectures, artist talks, camps, classes, film screenings, happenings at the Tomorrow Theater, and more!

Compare the levels below to start exploring your options.

* ###  [ Individual ](/web/20260113093419/https://portlandartmuseum.org/membership/individual)

$90/year 

Free admission for one.  
Pays for itself after 3 visits. 

* ###  [ Dual ](/web/20260113093419/https://portlandartmuseum.org/membership/dual)

$129/year 

Free admission for two.  
Pays for itself after 2 visits. 

* ###  [ Friend ](/web/20260113093419/https://portlandartmuseum.org/membership/friend)

$179/year 

Free admission for two.  
Access to 50 major museums across the country  
2 guest passes.  
Monthly installment plans available. 

* ###  [ Sponsor ](/web/20260113093419/https://portlandartmuseum.org/membership/sponsor)

$285/year 

All the benefits of the Friend and 4 guest passes.  
Monthly installment plans available. 

* ###  [ Sustainer ](/web/20260113093419/https://portlandartmuseum.org/membership/sustainer)

$600/year 

All the benefits of the Sponsor.  
Gift membership for two.  
Insider access to special events.  
Monthly installment plans ava...
accessibility_text:
****Updated 9/28/25****

## Exhibition information

[**Global Icons, Local Spotlight: Contemporary Art from the Collections of Jordan D. Schnitzer**](http://web.archive.org/web/20260105193749/https://portlandartmuseum.org/event/global-icons/)****  
Sep 6, 2025 – Jan 11, 2026

Note: The first gallery in this exhibition includes a neon work and a work with a mirror which may be a photosensitivity trigger for some visitors. Please reach out if you have any questions or would like to be guided to a gallery entrance that avoids these works.

## Accessibility contact information

[access@pam.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20260105193749/mailto:access@pam.org)

503-276-4284: phone

503-420-3169: direct videophone for Deaf visitors

## Purchasing tickets

  * **Ticket purchasing:** Tickets can be purchased [online](http://web.archive.org/web/20260105193749/https://portlandartmuseum.org/tickets/) or at the box office. If these processes aren’t accessible to you, please contact our access email or phone line for assistance.
  * **Admission access programs:** Reduced ticket prices are available for visitors through our [Admission Access Programs](http://web.archive.org/web/20260105193749/https://portlandartmuseum.org/plan-your-visit/admission-access-programs/).
  * **Complimentary companion tickets:** Companions and care-providers accompanying Disabled visitors receive free admission. Purchase your ticket then email or call us with your name, contact info, date/time of your ticket, and...
collections_text:
* Connect

View of the Portland Art Museum’s Mark Rothko Pavilion, Tim and Mary Boyle West Plaza. Featured artwork: the sun by Ugo Rondinone. Photo by Jeremy Bittermann, 2025.
  * Discover

View of the Whitsell Family Gallery in the Mark Rothko Pavilion of the Portland Art Museum, looking Northwest. Photo by Jeremy Bittermann, 2025.
  * Share

View of the new Eugene and Bonnie Skourtes Gallery at the Portland Art Museum, facing South. Photo by Jeremy Bittermann, 2025.
  * Participate

##  [ PAM CUT @ The Whitsell ](http://web.archive.org/web/20260116023245/https://portlandartmuseum.org/whitsell)

A new destination for PAM CUT programming in film, new media, and visual storytelling.

[Learn more](http://web.archive.org/web/20260116023245/https://portlandartmuseum.org/whitsell)

Exhibitions

###  [ Rick Bartow: Storyteller ](http://web.archive.org/web/20260116023245/https://portlandartmuseum.org/event/rick-bartow-storyteller/)

Bartow’s gift as a visual storyteller takes us on a narrative journey: his self-portraits tell stories of pain, memory, and self-discovery; others reflect on his Wiyot identity, Native history and culture; and his portrayals of beings who walk on four legs, swim, or fly deftly capture their essence.

1219 SW Park Ave

Nov 20, 2025 – May 23, 2026

Exhibitions

###  [ David Hockney: Works from the Collections of Jordan D. Schnitzer and His Family Foundation ](http://web.archive.org/web/20260116023245/https://portlandartmuseum.org/event/david-hockney/)
